solution.text:
Cost to paint CSA of the cylinder\(=\)Rs.\(_{{trunc((2*pi_val*k*j*l),2)}}_\)
Rate of painting\(=\)Rs.\(_{l}_\) per sq.m.
Length of cylinder, h\(=_{j}_\,m\)
Now,
Cost to paint CSA=CSA \(\times\) Rate
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc((2*pi_val*k*j*l),2)}}_=\)CSA \(\times _{l}_\)
\(\Rightarrow\) CSA \(=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*k*j),3)}}_\,m^2\)
We know, CSA\(=2\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc((2*pi_val*k*j),3)}}_=2 \times \pi r \times _{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow r = \frac{_{{trunc((2*pi_val*k*j),3)}}_}{2 \times \pi \times _{j}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = _{k}_\,m\)

content.text:
It costs Rs.\(_{{trunc((2*pi_val*k*j*l),2)}}_\) to paint the curved surface area of a cylindrical object of length \(_{j}_\,m\) at a rate of Rs.\(_{l}_\) per sq.m. Find:
The radius of the base.
